title: Recycling: Watch our video to find out what happens with recyclables in the blue bins - Miami University
summary: The article discusses the recycling program at Miami University, where recyclables are collected and processed at Rumpke Waste & Recycling's material recovery center. The Miami recycling program uses robotic arms, optical sorting, magnets, and other methods to separate and process recyclables, which are then sold to regional manufacturers to make new products.

title: Why Tennessee would benefit from recycling more glass | Opinion - Tennessean
summary: Glass recycling has numerous environmental and economic benefits, including reduced energy use, lower carbon emissions, and less waste in landfills. Strategic Materials, Inc. (SMI) is a glass recycler in Tennessee that supports the Tennessee CLEAN Act, which aims to prevent litter and incentivize litter prevention. The Tennessee CLEAN Act would provide resources and infrastructure for sustainability and recycling programs, which would help to create a more sustainable economy in Tennessee.
green_innovation: TRUE, Glass recycling contributes to environmental sustainability goals by reducing waste and conserving natural resources.
business_innovation: TRUE, Glass recycling is a new or improved business process that differs significantly from the firm's previous business processes and that has been brought into use in the firm.
green_product: TRUE, Recycled glass is a green product because it is manufactured in a way that significantly reduces its environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: TRUE, Glass recycling is a green process because it minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability by reducing waste, conserving natural resources, and decreasing energy consumption.
